name: Instant Pot Cream Stew
description: This creamy, hearty, and delicious Japanese Cream Stew is a popular Western-style (yoshoku) dish consisting of chicken and vegetables with a savory white sauce.¬†Cooked in the Instant Pot, it‚Äòs true comfort food in the cold winter months!¬†

video.description:
This creamy, hearty, and delicious Japanese Cream Stew is a popular western-style (yoshoku) dish consisting of chicken and vegetables with a savory white sauce.¬† Cooked in the Instant Pot, it's a true comfort food in cold winter months!¬†

RECIPE starts ‚ñ∂ 00:34

PRINT RECIPE ‚ñ∂ http://bit.ly/InstantPotCreamStew

I'm wearing a necklace from NozomiProject (http://nozomiproject.com/)!  The Nozomi Project is a social enterprise in Ishinomaki, Japan ‚Äî one of the hardest hit areas during 2011 Tohoku Earthquake and Tsunami.  The ladies at the Nozomi Project make beautiful jewelry with broken pieces of pottery left by the horrible disaster, and the Nozomi Project brings sustainable income, community, dignity, strength, and hope for these women. Let's support Nozomi Project together!

Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 60 minutes
Servings: 4

INGREDIENTS

1 lb chicken thigh (454 g)(substitute with more vegetables for vegetarian)
¬Ω tsp kosher salt
Freshly ground black pepper
2 potatoes (I used russet potatoes)
1 carrot
1 onion
4-5 mushrooms
1 head broccoli
1 Tbsp olive oil
1 Tbsp unsalted butter
1 ¬æ cup chicken broth (400 ml)(or vegetable broth)
1 bay leaf

White Sauce
3 Tbsp unsalted butter (42 g)
3 Tbsp all-purpose flour (45 g)
1/8 tsp white pepper (highly recommend!)
Freshly ground black pepper
¬Ω - 1 tsp kosher salt
1 cup milk (240 ml)(I used 2% lactose milk)

INSTRUCTIONS with step-by-step pics ‚ñ∂ http://bit.ly/InstantPotCreamStew

Instant Pot Cream Stew „ÇØ„É™„Éº„É†„Ç∑„ÉÅ„É•„Éº„ÅÆ‰Ωú„ÇäÊñπ (ÂúßÂäõÈçã) („É¨„Ç∑„Éî)

recipeIngredient: 1 lb chicken thigh ((substitute with vegetables/mashrooms for vegetarian))
1 box Japanese Cream Stew Mix ((or make your own with my White Sauce/Bechamel Sauce recipe below))

itemListElement.text: Peel and cut 2 potatoes into large chunks (if you want to keep their shape when serving).
itemListElement.name: Peel and cut 2 potatoes into large chunks (if you want to keep their shape when serving).

itemListElement.text: Peel 1 carrot and cut into smaller chunks. I use the rangiri Japanese cutting technique.
itemListElement.name: Peel 1 carrot and cut into smaller chunks. I use the rangiri Japanese cutting technique.

itemListElement.text: Cut 1 onion in half lengthwise, and then cut each half into 6 wedges. Finally, cut them in half widthwise.
itemListElement.name: Cut 1 onion in half lengthwise, and then cut each half into 6 wedges. Finally, cut them in half widthwise.

itemListElement.text: Slice 5 mushrooms and cut 1 head broccoli into florets.
itemListElement.name: Slice 5 mushrooms and cut 1 head broccoli into florets.

itemListElement.text: Cut 1 lb chicken thigh into smaller pieces. I use the sogigiri Japanese cutting technique to create more surface area so the chicken pieces cook¬†faster. Season the chicken with ¬Ω tsp Diamond Crystal kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper.
itemListElement.name: Cut 1 lb chicken thigh into smaller pieces. I use the sogigiri Japanese cutting technique to create more surface area so the chicken pieces cook¬†faster. Season the chicken with ¬Ω tsp Diamond Crystal kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper.

recipeInstructions.name: To Cook the Stew in the Instant Pot

itemListElement.text: Press the Saut√© button on your Instant Pot and heat 1 Tbsp olive oil and 1 Tbsp unsalted butter.
itemListElement.name: Press the Saut√© button on your Instant Pot and heat 1 Tbsp olive oil and 1 Tbsp unsalted butter.

itemListElement.text: When the pot is hot and the butter is melted, add the chicken.
itemListElement.name: When the pot is hot and the butter is melted, add the chicken.

itemListElement.text: Stir and coat the chicken with the oil.
itemListElement.name: Stir and coat the chicken with the oil.

itemListElement.text: Add the onion, carrot, mushrooms, and potatoes.
itemListElement.name: Add the onion, carrot, mushrooms, and potatoes.

itemListElement.text: Add 1¬æ cups chicken stock/broth and 1 bay leaf.
itemListElement.name: Add 1¬æ cups chicken stock/broth and 1 bay leaf.

itemListElement.text: Close the lid and set to High pressure for 2 minutes. If you‚Äòre making the homemade white sauce, wait until after pressure cooking is done to add it to the stew (see below). If you‚Äòre using the packaged¬†1 box Japanese Cream Stew Mix, add it now; break it up into small cubes and place them ON TOP of the ingredients (DO NOT MIX). Then, close the lid to cook. Once the pressure cooking is done, stir and wait to see how it thickens.¬†Add more cubes to achieve the consistency you like.
itemListElement.name: Close the lid and set to High pressure for 2 minutes. If you‚Äòre making the homemade white sauce, wait until after pressure cooking is done to add it to the stew (see below). If you‚Äòre using the packaged¬†1 box Japanese Cream Stew Mix, add it now; break it up into small cubes and place them ON TOP of the ingredients (DO NOT MIX). Then, close the lid to cook. Once the pressure cooking is done, stir and wait to see how it thickens.¬†Add more cubes to achieve the consistency you like.

itemListElement.text: Make sure the steam release handle points at Sealing and not Venting. The float valve goes up when pressurized.
itemListElement.name: Make sure the steam release handle points at Sealing and not Venting. The float valve goes up when pressurized.

itemListElement.text: While pressure cooking, blanch the broccoli. Bring water to a boil in a small saucepan. Once boiling, add a pinch of salt and the broccoli florets.
itemListElement.name: While pressure cooking, blanch the broccoli. Bring water to a boil in a small saucepan. Once boiling, add a pinch of salt and the broccoli florets.

itemListElement.text: Cook until tender but do not overcook. Transfer the broccoli to ice water to stop cooking further. Once cool, remove, drain, and set aside.
itemListElement.name: Cook until tender but do not overcook. Transfer the broccoli to ice water to stop cooking further. Once cool, remove, drain, and set aside.

recipeInstructions.name: To Make the White Sauce (Bechamel Sauce)

itemListElement.text: In a saucepan, melt 3 Tbsp unsalted butter on medium heat but don‚Äôt let it brown. Microwave 1 cup milk until it is warm to the touch and set aside.
itemListElement.name: In a saucepan, melt 3 Tbsp unsalted butter on medium heat but don‚Äôt let it brown. Microwave 1 cup milk until it is warm to the touch and set aside.

itemListElement.text: Once the butter is melted completely, add 3 Tbsp all-purpose flour (plain flour).
itemListElement.name: Once the butter is melted completely, add 3 Tbsp all-purpose flour (plain flour).

itemListElement.text: Stir quickly and constantly with a whisk to combine. Cook the flour mixture for 3‚Äì4 minutes, without letting it brown.
itemListElement.name: Stir quickly and constantly with a whisk to combine. Cook the flour mixture for 3‚Äì4 minutes, without letting it brown.

itemListElement.text: Pour a small amount of the warm milk at a time, and stir as the sauce thickens.
itemListElement.name: Pour a small amount of the warm milk at a time, and stir as the sauce thickens.

itemListElement.text: Gradually add the rest of the milk by whisking continually until smooth. Cook, stirring constantly, until starting to bubble and thicken.
itemListElement.name: Gradually add the rest of the milk by whisking continually until smooth. Cook, stirring constantly, until starting to bubble and thicken.

itemListElement.text: Lower the heat and add ‚Öõ tsp white pepper powder and ¬Ω‚Äì1 tsp Diamond Crystal kosher salt to taste.
itemListElement.name: Lower the heat and add ‚Öõ tsp white pepper powder and ¬Ω‚Äì1 tsp Diamond Crystal kosher salt to taste.

itemListElement.text: Cook, stirring constantly, for 2 to 3 minutes. Remove from the heat and set aside.
itemListElement.name: Cook, stirring constantly, for 2 to 3 minutes. Remove from the heat and set aside.

itemListElement.text: When it‚Äôs finished cooking, the Instant Pot will switch automatically to the Keep Warm mode. Let the pressure release naturally for 15 minutes and then proceed with the quick release by turning the steam release handle to the Venting position to let steam out until the float valve drops down.¬†Tip: Hold a kitchen towel and do not place your hand or face over the steam release valve. There should only be a little bit of steam left after 15 minutes of natural release.
itemListElement.name: When it‚Äôs finished cooking, the Instant Pot will switch automatically to the Keep Warm mode. Let the pressure release naturally for 15 minutes and then proceed with the quick release by turning the steam release handle to the Venting position to let steam out until the float valve drops down.¬†Tip: Hold a kitchen towel and do not place your hand or face over the steam release valve. There should only be a little bit of steam left after 15 minutes of natural release.

itemListElement.text: Open the lid and insert a skewer in the center of the potato to see if it‚Äôs cooked through.
itemListElement.name: Open the lid and insert a skewer in the center of the potato to see if it‚Äôs cooked through.

itemListElement.text: Using a ladle, take out 1 cup of soup broth from the stew.
itemListElement.name: Using a ladle, take out 1 cup of soup broth from the stew.

itemListElement.text: Put the white sauce back on the stove and heat on low heat. Add several tablespoons of the soup and whisk well to combine.
itemListElement.name: Put the white sauce back on the stove and heat on low heat. Add several tablespoons of the soup and whisk well to combine.

itemListElement.text: Gradually add the rest of cup of soup, stirring constantly, to combine.
itemListElement.name: Gradually add the rest of cup of soup, stirring constantly, to combine.

itemListElement.text: Pour the white sauce into the Instant Pot and gently mix the white sauce with the rest of the stew.
itemListElement.name: Pour the white sauce into the Instant Pot and gently mix the white sauce with the rest of the stew.

itemListElement.text: Press the Saut√© button on your Instant Pot and press Adjust to set Less heat.
itemListElement.name: Press the Saut√© button on your Instant Pot and press Adjust to set Less heat.

itemListElement.text: The stew will thicken as it‚Äòs heated. Season with freshly ground black pepper and discard the bay leaf if you can find it.
itemListElement.name: The stew will thicken as it‚Äòs heated. Season with freshly ground black pepper and discard the bay leaf if you can find it.

itemListElement.text: Add the blanched broccoli and heat up. Serve steamed rice on one side of the bowl and pour the Cream Stew on the other side of the bowl.
itemListElement.name: Add the blanched broccoli and heat up. Serve steamed rice on one side of the bowl and pour the Cream Stew on the other side of the bowl.

itemListElement.text: You can keep the leftovers in an airtight container and store in the refrigerator for up to 4 days or in the freezer for up to 3 months (but remove potatoes as they will change the texture once frozen).
itemListElement.name: You can keep the leftovers in an airtight container and store in the refrigerator for up to 4 days or in the freezer for up to 3 months (but remove potatoes as they will change the texture once frozen).

review.reviewBody: It's funny that this is a dish I crave from home now that I live in the states! My family loves it. This is also the dish I bring to new mommas after they give birth. Everyone tells me it's such a comforting stew. This recipe is spot on! So easy too. Thank you so much!

I've been wanting to try this ever since I watched it on The Makanai. I added a bit of garlic and ginger when cooking the stew, but otherwise followed the recipe to a T. Turned out great and everyone loved it!

Delicious! Once I had a first taste, couldn't help myself to add a little nutmeg however! 
Thanks for the recipe :)
I love to make this all the time in the cold months, and I use the leftovers for chicken pot pie :) so good. Using Maitake tonight because they were on sale!
Can I ask where did you get the gold silverware for the photos?  I love the long thin handles that look like chopsticks.
In Germany we have something similar: Chicken fricassee, its with onions, carrots, peas, mushrooms and black salsify or asparagus.
I was wondering if i could use a slow cooker instead, if i were to use a slow cooker, how long does it need to cook for and what should i increase or decrease with?
This recipe is brilliant. It tastes so much better than the packaged mix. I love all of your recipes. They taste so great and bring back nice memories of living in Japan :)
